attributes.action: Establish extradition treaties so British victims of crime are supported.
attributes.background: I want to raise the issue of the safety of British Nationals and their families overseas and develop on the international extradition treaties and assistance that is in place.
attributes.additional_details: If you or a member of your family has been subjected to a crime a suspected criminal can flee to another country or back to the UK that has no treaty in place and will not face any criminal proceedings.

attributes.action: Provide humanitarian assistance to Peru to help those affected by flooding
attributes.background: Provide comprehensive and timely assistance to help those affected by catastrophic flooding across Peru. At least 78 people have already been confirmed dead and approximately 640,000 have been displaced. Urgent support is needed to prevent further casualties and the outbreak of preventable diseases.
attributes.additional_details: The European Commission has mobilised â‚¬250,000 for emergency relief in Peru. While this is an important move, it is nowhere near sufficient for dealing with the catastrophic crisis that is already affecting hundreds of thousands of people and will affect many more. These floods will have even more devastating impacts unless the international community provides an adequate and timely response to reinforce the national effort. Safe drinking water, food and medical assistance is urgently required.

attributes.action: DFID should Stop its aid to Tanzania
attributes.background: We are taxpayers should expect our money to be used in an ethical way. When there are clear breaches of political rights or human rights we expect a response in terms of the aid we contribute. The fact that the US has reacted in such a strong way gives a very good signal.

attributes.action: Classify acid as an offensive weapon and increase sentences for acid attacks.
attributes.background: Corrosive liquids can be bought easily in DIY stores or online and disguised in drinks bottles. In law, a stabbing is an attempted murder, while an acid attack is only GBH. There's no specific offence regarding acid attacks, even though the impact on the victim can be far worse than a stabbing.
attributes.additional_details:
As reported by the BBC, there has been a sharp rise in attacks involving corrosive fluids in London over the last four years.

Since the start of 2017 there have been 49 crimes where "corrosive fluids" were thrown with "intent to cause grievous bodily harm" or to "cause an explosion".

attributes.action: Hold a Snap General Election on 4th May 2017
attributes.background: The Government would be able to negotiate Brexit with a stronger mandate if they had a larger majority in Parliament. It would also make getting future bills passed easier.

attributes.action: Adapt law so all businesses charge for plastic bags
attributes.background: UK law doesn't require businesses with less than 250 employees to charge for plastic bags, but can do so voluntarily. Having worked at such a shop, they don't feel obliged to help save the environment if they're not forced to act. A voluntary basis isn't working thus a mandatory basis is required.
attributes.additional_details: In one shift (6.5 hrs) I would hand out 100-150 plastic bags for free. More often than not, 2 people are on the till at one time, 2 shifts are run per day, 7 days a week. This amounts to 2,800-4,200 bags handed out per week. Whilst the government have made excellent steps to make large businesses charge for their plastic bags, it is still critical every business participates to care for our environment. People expect to pay for a plastic bag, we now need that final push to reduce our usage.

attributes.action: Drivers who get banned to need to retake their driving test again
attributes.background: Drivers who have their driving license taken off them should be required to take their driving test again with set min amount of driving lessons as a new driver and driving license to be different colour.

attributes.action: Stop allowing employers to ask about criminal convictions before a job offer
attributes.background: Currently employers are allowed to ask an individual about their criminal convictions before a job offer is made. This is unfair and gives employers a "loophole" not to offer a position and say it was not because of criminal declarations but something else. This needs to change.
attributes.additional_details: If the legislation was changed to not allow employers to ask about criminal convictions until an offer of employment has been made it would be very hard for an employer then to say it was not because of an individuals criminal past allowing a more fair and just application process for ex-offenders. The current legislation is poor and despite it being illegal for an employer to not offer employment based solely on someone having a criminal record their are no current protections in place.

attributes.action: Make it so fluoride levels are clearly stated on all packaging through the UK
attributes.background: Toxic warnings are stated on most forms of packaging I.e cigerettes, alcohol & food so why is fluoride not?? It's a huge risk factor to our health ,many of us would like to manage our intake of fluoride. We ask that the levels are clearly stated on our food, drink & toothpastes
attributes.additional_details:
Research has suggested high levels of fluoride can not only effect our health as adults, it's having a major impact on our children. High levels of fluoride can be fatal, just like cigerettes, alcohol and sugars.   
2 examples of studies below..

http://www.foodandourhealth.com/bottled-water-filled-fluoride-heres-complete-list-brands-avoid/

http://fluoridealert.org/content/top_ten/

attributes.action: Only allow people between the ages 16 - 55 to vote.
attributes.background: By not allowing anyone over fifty to vote we give the younger generally the chance to make change, elderly people tend to be set in their ways and the country needs fresh mindsets, minds that are young and haven't been shaped by the world's media over the years, let the young have a say!
attributes.additional_details: We're all well and fine to charge teenagers tax for living independently, for working, or driving, but to say they have to help towards the government when the Government doesn't allow us to have a say in the country we contribute to is completely unfair.

attributes.action: Allow citizens over the age of ten to vote.
attributes.background: Children have an open mind and this will introduce them to democracy. I believe that children should be able to vote because I want the United Kingdom to be a true democracy.

attributes.action: Car insurance companies must renew policies at most competitive rate
attributes.background: Car insurance companies are profiteering from British drivers by increasing annual renewal premiums far above those offered to new customers. Only those savvy enough, and who have the time and ability to challenge the increases or search for another deal, escape these unfair penalties.
attributes.additional_details:
Drivers who fail to challenge the increased premiums are being charged as much as Â£40 more for the same policy than if they were a new customer.
With over 35 million vehicles licensed in the UK (DVLA; 2013), if each driver fails to challenge their increased premium, insurers could be tricking the public out of as much as Â£1.4 billion a year.
Drivers shouldn't be forced to search for the most competitive deal every year. This sneaky practice of overcharging existing customers should be illegal.

attributes.action: Make car ownership fairer by introducing a pay-per-mile car tax
attributes.background: The Government charges drivers a fixed amount of car tax no matter how much they use their cars. We urge Transport Secretary Chris Grayling to adopt a fairer Vehicle Excise Duty by charging motorists based on miles driven. Car tax can be paid during an MOT, with bills calculated from actual mileage.
attributes.additional_details:
http://blog.justmiles.co.uk/would-car-tax-be-fairer-if-we-paid-it-by-the-mile/

Independent reports suggest need for radical reforms to car tax: http://bit.ly/2mKvxXR

60% of motorists would prefer pay-per-mile car tax and over 50% would drive less: http://bit.ly/2ntKEEM

A trial of pay-per-mile tax in the USA found the distributional effects of a per mile flat vehicle tax fee did not place a significantly greater burden on either lower income or rural populations: http://bit.ly/2n1s614

attributes.action: Legal requirement employer must give employees payslip min a day before pay day
attributes.background:
Wages wrong on payday this can cause financial troubles.
Giving your payslip on payday gives you no time to plan corrective action. This may effect your credit score. When bills do not get paid etc. Especially when in some cases its the employer at fault not the employee but employee gets penalized

attributes.action: Ban the sale of energy and high caffeine beverages and foods to anyone under 16
attributes.background: Energy drinks and energy bars are all too available in shops to youngsters these days with potentially fatal consequences! Let's protect our children. Let's ban the sale of these products to those under 16!

attributes.action: Teach the history of British Empire to primary and secondary students accurately
attributes.background: When 59% of Britons feel proud of the British Empire, it is clear that education on Empire is incomplete. Changes need not instill guilt, but an accurate and accountable curriculum will instead motivate and educate students to create a more equal and just world. Full petition: http://wp.me/p8vFwG-4
attributes.additional_details: British domination in Africa, the Middle East, the Americas, Asia and Australia entailed land grabs, slavery, torture, mass murder, incarcerations without trial, racial segregation, kidnapping, genocide, war, exploitation, rape, and ecological devastation. If students can study the Holocaust, they can and must also learn about hundreds of years of imperial and colonial violence. The 2014 curriculum update also omits the immense positive contributions of racialized people to the Western world.

attributes.action: The government should reintroduce the dog licence which was abolished in 1987.
attributes.background: Dogs are sometimes treated by owners as controllable children. They are often not. An incredible amount of children and adults are attacked by breeds of dogs which are recognised as being so dangerous that even sizeable humans do not have the skills to tackle them. Even a lap dog can maul a baby.
attributes.additional_details: The Dog Licence was abolished in 1987. It was deemed difficult to enforce with only 50% of owners having a licence. This was pre the internet. A small charge of say Â£35 per dog or say Â£70 for a group of dogs paid online would be easy to administer. An online "ownership test" to get the licence might allow for education and enforcement of the act. It would allow the location of dangerous breeds to be known and for animal welfare and conflict with human to be reduced. It would not be onerous.

attributes.action: Lower the minimum age for opening a Help to Buy ISA.
attributes.background: It is increasingly difficult for the next generation to get onto the property ladder. It takes longer to save up for inflating deposits, so young people should be allowed to start incentivised savings sooner, and parents/grandparents allowed to gift into Help To Buy ISAs well before a person is 16.

attributes.action: Lorries to have their own lane on the motorway with a barrier
attributes.background: I got hit by a lorry cause the driver was falling asleep, now this will effect my insurance. Also many people are dying cause of lorries doing the same.

attributes.action: Where a treatment exists, provide fair and fast access for rare disease patients
attributes.background: People with rare diseases wait on average over 2 years for potentially life-changing treatments. Less than half of treatments approved in the last 15 years are funded by NHS England vs. 93% in Germany and 81% in France. If a treatment exists, access should be the same as for more common conditions.
attributes.additional_details:
The Department of Health, NICE and NHS England should work together with patient groups, clinical experts, and the Pharmaceutical Industry to establish a new and fair process for appraisal of rare disease medicines.

Data from the Report:
Equity and Access: Making the UK a Rare Disease Leader. (2017) Initiated and funded by Shire Pharmaceuticals and developed in collaboration with an external steering group

This petition, and the Equity and Access Report, were initiated and funded by Shire.

attributes.action: Amend British Summer Time start date.
attributes.background: Amend British Summer Time to be the period beginning at one o'clock, Greenwich mean time, in the morning of the first Sunday in March and ending at one o'clock, Greenwich mean time, in the morning of the last Sunday in October.

attributes.action: Car insurance prices shouldn't change from postcode to postcode
attributes.background: For instance, BT11 and BT17 insurance prices are very very high at around Â£5000 a year because they were associated with a bad reputation in the past. However, times have changed, and young drivers nowadays are more mature when it comes to owning a car and insurance.

attributes.action: Make healthy food cheaper and put the price up on junk food
attributes.background: I'm a Type 2 diabetic and I need to eat a healthy low carb diet but healthy food is so expensive so I tend to buy what I can afford. I have 4 children and a husband to feed as well and they don't eat healthy either because of the cost.

attributes.action: Wales is part of the UK so the Welsh flag should be included on the Union Flag.
attributes.background: I am often asked by pupils where I work why the national flag of Wales is not included on the Union Flag. Wales is a member of the UK and should be represented on it's flag. This could easily be done by adding the Welsh flag in a corner of the Union Flag. Wales deserves to be represented.

attributes.action: Increase the budget for the social care and the pension fund
attributes.background: Social Care and the Pension fund are some of the most undersupported yet most important parts of the budget. Businesses such as BHS that had a massive hole in their pension should not be allowed to fail their workers in this way.
attributes.additional_details: Many aspects of Social Care are criticised for being understaffed or poorly managed however with the budget the way it is they can not do anything to get this changed.

attributes.action: Make proper funding of existing schools the priority in this budget.
attributes.background: Existing schools in the UK are facing severe cuts to their budgets due to a number of policies that create additional costs or loss of income.  The government has failed to acknowledge this deficit, and schools are now facing extreme decisions, including: closures and staffing reductions.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/education/2017/mar/07/headteachers-write-to-parents-over-school-funding-and-job-cuts
Several recent policies are creating this deficit.  Schools must comply but have not been offered any funding to make this possible.   It affects all schools, even those who have been rated outstanding by OFSTED.   
Real spending on existing schools is falling by 6.5%.  https://www.theguardian.com/education/2017/feb/27/schools-to-be-hit-with-first-real-time-funding-cuts-in-20-years

attributes.action: Reduce Care Home fees and offer more help to the elderly
attributes.background:
Some elderly people pay almost Â£1000 a week for a care home. 

Â£1000 is too much for the elderly to afford in their last years. They should use that money for the things they want, and not an over priced bed.

attributes.action: Stop the advertising of alcohol.
attributes.background: People struggling with alcohol addiction face many daily struggles be it from withdrawals, anxiety, panic attacks. The list goes on, advertising of alcohol can often be a major trigger for someone suffering from alcohol dependencies when trying to remain abstinent.

attributes.action: Make it law that you have to move out of the way for emergency services.
attributes.background: I have seen a video in germany where they all move out of the way and make a space for the emergency services to get through easier and quicker. So by law I think we should have to do this in england.

attributes.action: Include school trips within 'childcare,' allowing payment by childcare vouchers
attributes.background: Childcare vouchers save working parents up to Â£935 each. At present, vouchers can be used for anything deemed as 'qualifying care,' however school trips do not currently fit within that criteria. Making it easier for parents to afford these expenses will allow more children access to these trips.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst childcare - under the 2006 childcare act - excludes care given during the school hours. I argue that residential trips, domestic or international, are beyond the remit of school care so should be categorised as 'qualifying care' and eligible for payment via voucher.

attributes.action: Improve rights of cohabiting unmarried women after a relationship breakdown
attributes.background: A married woman forced to leave her husband due to domestic violence is generally entitled to 50% of the couple's assets whereas an unmarried woman is entitled to nothing other than pitiful maintenance payments for her children but nothing for herself.
attributes.additional_details: It is ridiculous that, in this day and age, just because a cohabiting couple have not gone through a 30 minute marriage ceremony, the entitlement after a split to the assets they have accumulated together is completely different than in the case of if they are married. Invariably the woman, who often will be forced to leave with her children due to her partner's behaviour, will lose out. Scotland changed its laws in 2005 to give equal protection for cohabiting women, so why can't we do the same?

attributes.action: Free dental treatment for tax payers who pay into the nhs
attributes.background: I'm fed up for having to pay for dental treatment even though I pay my tax every month in which some of it goes into the NHS. Why should people on job seekers allowance etc get free dental care and treatment however us tax payers that support funding for the NHS have to pay.

attributes.action: The police should have proper foot patrols once again.
attributes.background: The number of police patrols I see has dwindled, I feel proper police foot patrols around towns and streets would prevent most petty crimes happening (as a police force should be a preventative force and not a reactive force).

attributes.action: Reverse any law that currently bans sale and/or posession of research chemicals.
attributes.background: It should be the choice of an individual to buy, and to use research chemicals according to their own will.

attributes.action: Make Schools In Britain Serve More Healthier Food To Students.
attributes.background: Lately, I've seen in various school canteens a lot of greasy food like pizzas, waffles, cakes with lots of sugary stuff etc. If you want the students to achieve more in the UK, then you should make the schools serve more healthier food.

attributes.action: Ban local councils from using unfair camera cars.
attributes.background: Dropping someone off at bus stop and a camera car catches you get a Â£55 pound fine these cars are unfair if you appeal all you get is you should not have done it.

attributes.action: Theresa May: Reverse the crippling cuts to local government
attributes.background: In recent years annual reductions in the grant paid by central government have crippled local authoritiesâ€™ ability to respond effectively to local needs. Local government has borne a disproportionate share of central governmentâ€™s austerity measures and it is now time to say "no more".
attributes.additional_details: In Eastbourne this has amounted to a savage reduction of almost 60% of the grant - Â£6m p/a. We call upon Eastbourneâ€™s MP and MPs from across the country to lobby the Prime Minister and the government for a better settlement and to continue to do so until such time that funding for local authoroties reaches the level it was pre-2015. Whilst the petition originates in Eastbourne, it draws attention to the impact of government grant cuts to local authorities across England.

attributes.action: Please exempt students of EU nationality from the CSI requirement
attributes.background:
Please exempt students holding EU nationality from the requirement of having comprehensive sickness insurance when applying for permanent residency document.
Most of us are in their 20s, healthy, and been living in the UK most of our life. No one really knew about this requirement until recently.
attributes.additional_details:
Most of us, despite often speaking better English than our parents' language, realise that we are not eligible to residency documents because of CSI requirement only when our application gets rejected.

https://www.gov.uk/eea-registration-certificate/permanent-residence
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-39014191
https://www.freemovement.org.uk/comprehensive-sickness-insurance-what-is-it-and-who-needs-it/

attributes.action: Share/Stakeholder,hedge fund,& companies using robots should pay social care tax
attributes.background: Share/stake holders who receive over Â£50,000 in dividends, hedge funds, and companies that replace workers with automation often fail to reinvest their profits in the workforce and payrates. As the workforce pays taxes, these companies are also depriving the Government of taxes and NI contributions.
attributes.additional_details: The Government should therefore introduce a new 'Social care tax' on share and stake holders, hedge funds, and companies who use automation. The Government must only use this income for social care.  It would help county councils tackle shortages in their social care budgets without making cuts elsewhere, including council tax rises. This tax would also help the NHS with their budget sort falls.

attributes.action: Primary & secondary school teachers should be paid a minimum of Â£25,000 PA
attributes.background: Teaching is crucial in getting children the best learning and teachers are not paid enough for the amount of work they do. They should be paid a minimum of Â£25,000 with it to raise to Â£30,000 a year minimum after 3 years at the same school. This will help teachers become more stable at 1 school.

attributes.action: People who get ill because of drug abuse, and obesity should pay healthcare.
attributes.background: Drug abuse and alcoholism cost the N.H.S. Â£3.5 billion a year each, smoking costs Â£5 billion a year, and obesity Â£6.5 billion a year. That is Â£15 billion altogether. That means taxpayer is being forced to hand Â£500 to help those who don't help themselves. This must end.

attributes.action: Consider moving Britainâ€™s Parliament to Manchester
attributes.background: As a solution to the problem of the eye watering expense of renovating The Palace of Westminster
attributes.additional_details: http://www.economist.com/blogs/bagehot/2017/02/go-north

attributes.action: Longer prison sentences for rape, murder and serious crimes.
attributes.background: A 23-year-old man was lured to a park and beaten for several hours and later died,The murderers were given 20 & 21 yrs. A man has been jailed for 12 years after he attacked a woman so badly that her face became completely detached from her skull. Given 12 yrs. NOT LONG ENOUGH!
attributes.additional_details: We keep getting told that our prisons are over crowded! they may well be, but how many of those offer no threat to the general public? let them out and get them doing work for the community and free the beds for the rapist, murders and child sex offenders that we want off our streets so it can be a safer place to bring a family up in. And then give longer sentences to these offenders and that might deter others, and they will think twice before reoffending. Then our prisons will have vacancies.

attributes.action: Both Parents assumed Equal parental rights(50 50) unless safeguarding issue .
attributes.background: The continued removal of loving parents through the family courts when one party has less rights, I believe is putting strain on our society as its causing the parents and the children mental health issues( such as self esteem), which in the long term is having a detrimental impact on our nation.

attributes.action: Stop Council Household Waste Recycling Centres charging for any domestic waste.
attributes.background: Councils are increasingly starting to charge for waste deemed as non-household waste despite deriving from a household. This includes, rubble, plasterboard, sanitary ware, drainage pipes etc.This is not cost effective and will increase the amount of fly tipping.This excludes commercial derived waste
attributes.additional_details:
Staffordshire county council charge Â£6 to dispose of a toilet with cistern. 
Â£3 per bag of rubble or plasterboard. etc view their website for more details. 

Councils should aim to encourage recycling and correct disposal of waste, not discourage it by charging.

attributes.action: Stronger penalties against Hash smoking or possession
attributes.background: I am a London resident who has to deal with hash smokers every day. These people aren't like weed smokers, they are so much worse. The hash smells so much and stinks my building up, plus the hash they're smoking is mostly rubber and mud and it does horrible things to their bodies unlike weed smoke.

attributes.action: Legislate Against the Selling or Gifting of Customer Details
attributes.background:
Nearly all companies offer to "send me details of products and offers from third party organisations recommended by [the company]".

While it's very nice of them to offer this, the onus should be on the customer to sign up to these other companies, rather than our details be sold on for profit.
attributes.additional_details:
Let's face it, nobody wants their details sold or gifted to another company only to be written to and persuaded to purchase other goods or services that are by and large unwanted.

This legislation would eradicate the many double-negative tick boxes when forced to create accounts online and ultimately help individuals know EXACTLY which companies have their details.

attributes.action: Student phones to be given in to staff in all lessons in schools and  colleges.
attributes.background: Use of smart phones is increasingly interrupting learning, students constantly text friends and use social media during lessons which impacts on their learning and distracts others. Teachers need government support to require educational establishments to ensure phones are handed in to avoid this.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/education/2015/may/16/schools-mobile-phones-academic-results
https://www.gov.uk/government/news/impact-of-smartphones-on-behaviour-in-lessons-to-be-reviewed

attributes.action: Close time-based versus process-based loophole in Local Government Act 1974
attributes.background: The Local Government Act 1974 currently requires the complaints process at local level to be fully exhausted before cases are brought to the Local Government Ombudsman. The Local Government Ombudsman will not investigate cases that are more than 12 months' old. These constraints can be incompatible.
attributes.additional_details:
This petition originates from a planning application submitted to a local authority.

Objection to the application was submitted and the planning authority admitted procedural error; however granted permission to the applicant. The decision was complained about on the basis of a procedural impropriety however the planning authority refused to quash their decision.

An escalation to the Local Government Ombudsman was declined on the basis of time, even though the complaints process was followed.

attributes.action: Replace number plates with a road-tax disk like bar code
attributes.background: Many people do not like the look of number plates due to the bulky look & on many new cars, they do not seem to match aesthetically. Also, number plates can be stolen easily however with a tax-disk like sticker it is harder. It would reduce the amount of number plate thefts; assisting the police.
attributes.additional_details: For police investigation, they can read it like a number plate and it will come up on the police computer with all of the vehicles details.
